result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy J. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
an indeterminate sentence with lifetime sex offender registration
Concurrent with: any other sentences

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy J. Peterson

records.addlTxt: Cover Letter From Branch 2, Judge Klicko to DOC Records Supervisor, Cydney Selje
from DOC to Judge Klicko

10:09 AM  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremy J. Peterson appeared by video, in custody at New Lisbon Correctional.  Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared by video for Jeremy J. Peterson.  Court states case and appearances.  DE waives his right to appear in person for today's hearing.  Court accepts that waiver.  Atty Dolch states agreement.  State is in agreement and notes there is no credit.  Atty Dolch is in agreement there is no credit.  Court questions DE on the written plea questionaire and the plea agreement.  Court advises DE of the definitions of the charges he is pleading to.  Court advises DE re: voting rights, felony firearms warnings, body armor warnings and effects of pleading to child sexual assault as to employment, etc.  DE pleads NC.  Court accepts plea/finds DE guilty.  State notes they are in compliance w/victim notice rights and makes statement re: 2 VIS's filed and notes both victims didn't want to appear today and wanted a consecutive sentence.  Atty Dolch has reviewed VIS w/DE.  State states the joint recommendation.  Atty Dolch makes statement.  DE has nothing to add.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

Ct 1:  NC
10 years prison indeterminate - concurrent to any other sentences
$30 in court costs
Lifetime sex offender registration
Ct 2:  Dismissed/read-in
MTH
DEW

Atty Dolch acknowledges rec. information and waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Dolch stands mute.  Court enters NG pleas.  Bond continued.  Plea/sent already set for 8/5/22 at 10:00 a.m.

10:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremy J. Peterson appeared by video, in custody at New Lisbon Correctional.  Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared by video for Jeremy J. Peterson.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Dolch states DE will waive his right to prelim today and waives his right to be present in person for the waiver.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on his waiver of right to prelim and waiver of right to appear in person/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over.

10:15 AM Defendant Jeremy J. Peterson by Zoom audio and video from New Lisbon Correctional with attorney Leonie Dolch by Zoom audio and video.  Defendant Jeremy J. Peterson in custody.  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds waiver of time limits to be free, knowing and voluntary.  Atty Dolch requests a preliminary hearing.  Matter reset.  Atty Dolch will be in touch with parties regarding the need for an OTP or by Zoom.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Instructions to Appear Remotely
New Lisbon Correctional
Preliminary hearing on April 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.

11:27 AM Attorney Leonie Dolch in court.  Rick C Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes DE is in custody at New Lisbon Correctional and no OTP was prepared.  State is not sure why no OTP was completed.  Atty Dolch suggests setting matter on for next week and does not see a point in the State dismissing case and refiling same.  Matter reset.  OTP to be done.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.
